website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, but high quality stand that keeps your switch safely in place while you play.
pros: Multi-view angles lock securely into place
The wide base provides stability to the lightweight stand
The stand folds up small enough to fit in your pocket
Plastic material is strong and the switch fits perfectly
Access to charging ports through the stand
cons: The stand is extremely lightweight, and is easy to knock over when the switch is not weighing it down

customer_reviews.title: A great item at a fair price. Very portable.
customer_reviews.text: This affordably priced plastic stand addresses the primary design flaw of the Nintendo Switch, the fact that the type-C connector is in the bottom. This stand allows you to play in "tabletop"mode while charging. Although it is a bit difficult to open, it folds to a compact size. Fits in the back pocket of my jeans, but I doubt it could survive being sat on. It also fits into the top of my Breath of The Wild Switch Travel case. Works great as a stand for the Switch, if you want to play on the integrated display with Joycons detached while charging. Has rubber grips, and posts on either side of the charger cutout to prevent sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin R Allen

customer_reviews.title: Destroys the Hori Stand!  For $6 its a steal!
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the Hori stand. So many more positions that securely lock into place. I returned the hori stand because it felt like it was going to fall over or the latch would fail. This stand has a wider base and feels more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Drea

customer_reviews.title: Great stand.
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions carefully before opening this little guy up the first time cuz I was afraid I would break it. It was easier than I expected. This stand really works and fits the Nintendo Switch like a glove. It also will hold my phone nicely. It’s a great thing for my desk. Another Amazon Basics win!
customer_reviews.author: Spunky Punky Sparkle Princess

customer_reviews.title: A solution for a problem I didn't anticipate
customer_reviews.text: After playing with my Switch for a while I noticed something unexpected: For me, playing in handheld mode isn't very comfortable! I needed to explore my options. I think the majority of my issue is with the compact nature of the JoyCons. The solution? Tabletop mode with a controller! I like having the ability to charge the console while playing. A perceived design flaw inherent to the Switch is the location of the USB port (on the bottom). A stand is required to charge in tabletop mode. This is a fully functional stand. It's plastic. It will probably break at some point. I will likely purchase another. WARNING: flat surface sold separately!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I say get it! It’s nice!
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged, easy to set up but I felt like I was going to break the snaps the first time I unfolded it and set it up so be careful with it until you get used to it. It holds the Switch very well and is simple to adjust! I use it a lot because tabletop mode is my favorite mode to play me-a some-a Super Mario Odyssey! Definitely pick one up if you use tabletop mode as the built in stand on the actual Switch is pretty lousy IMO. SWITCH LIFE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Rogillio

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found!
customer_reviews.text: A little confusing to understand at first (make sure to actually read the directions), I'd say it's the best stand so far. It has plenty of air flow, and it's a lot more sturdy than others as it actually has to click into place instead of leaning against a small rail on the bottom. A bit large, but a small sacrifice for that peace of mind. And the price isn't that bad either. I say, if you're worried the others will fall on you or won't last, go for it! Better to be safe than sorry with a $300 system.

customer_reviews.title: Great for sore hands!

This stand is the best money I have spent and adjustable to fit the angle you want depending on where you are putting the device. It is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Batwings

customer_reviews.title: Better than the official stand!
customer_reviews.text: I like this so much better than the official Nintendo switch stand. It’s large, it’s sturdy and it locks in to place. If you bump into it, it stays put on the chosen adjustment! It won’t flatten and drop the gamepad onto the floor! Which is what almost happened with the Nintendo switch stand. Official Nintendo switch stand (pros): •none! Official Nintendo switch stand (cons): •it’s very small •very flimsy •does not lock into place so your $300 investment is secured by LUCK, rather than a locking mechanism. I’m very satisfied with this AmazonBasics stand! I returned the official Nintendo switch stand, right after I took this photo.
